Notice for Board Member Candidates

As per the Governor’s Executive Order No. 202.26, the deadline for qualified candidates is Monday, May 11, 2020. The Governor has eliminated any minimum threshold of signatures required, provided, however, an individual must meet any other requirements necessary to be placed on the ballot, including any applicable residency and age requirements.

Candidates who wish their name to appear on the ballot for election to the Board of Education must notify Ms. Susan Temple, District Clerk in writing by Monday, May 11, 2020. Candidates will be listed on the ballot in alphabetical order.

As per School Law, to be qualified to run for the Board of Education, you must be able to read and write, be a qualified voter of the District, and a resident of the District for the continuous year prior to the election, you may not reside with another member of the same school board as a member of the same family, you may not be a current employee of the school board, and may not simultaneously hold another pubic office.

Susan J. Temple
District Clerk
May 5, 2020

Delaware Academy Central School District at Delhi has two full term vacancies (3 years each) for board members. Mr. Mark Schneider and Mr. Kenneth Aikens hold terms that will expire on June 30, 2020.

If you are interested in running for a Board seat, you may pick up a petition in the District Office between the hours of 8:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. The petition must be signed by at least 25 qualified school district residents and returned to the District Clerk by 5:00 p.m. on Monday, April 20, 2020.

As per School Law, to be qualified to run for the Board, you must be able to read and write, be a qualified voter of the District and a resident of the District for the continuous year prior to the election, you may not reside with another member of the same school board as a member of the same family, you may not be a current employee of the school board, and may not simultaneously hold another public office.

post_text: Students from the Delaware Academy S.A.D.D. Chapter recently visited 8th grade health class to educate students on healthy, unhealthy and dangerous relationships. The lesson pertained to any type of relationship from friendship to dating relationships. Students were given specific examples of what healthy, unhealthy and dangerous relationships may look like. Members of S.A.D.D. feel that many students, even with positive influences from home and other settings, do not fully understand the differences between these relationships. The 8th grade students were also given the tools to better understand when a relationship should be ended as well as healthy ways to end them. Students discussed different resources available to them both in and out of school should they need help with an unhealthy or dangerous relationship. These resources included teachers, parents, school counselors and other local organizations such as Safe Against Violence. Our mission is to give students the tools to demand nothing less than safe, healthy and happy relationships.

shared_text:
Delhi Fire Department
June 18, 2019 at 11:42 PM ·

On Sunday, May 26, Delaware Academy Junior Kayleigh Verspoor rescued two canoeists from Delta Lake in Rome, NY. At the time, Kayleigh was working as a counselor at Haven Camp, a camp for disabled adults. While taking a camper fishing at the lake, Kayleigh observed a capsized canoe in the lake and two individuals in the water. Both individuals were wearing personal flotation devices, however neither could swim.
Kayleigh, a trained lifegaurd, swam out to the stranded boaters and was able to assist both to safety. We the the Delhi Fire Department wish to recognize Kayleigh’s selfless act, and thank her for responding when others needed help. We are proud to see the efforts of young people in our community when it comes to helping their fellow man.
Kayleigh was awarded a plaque in recognition of her efforts from the Fire Department, and was also awarded The Superstar Award from the Delaware County Sheriffs Department.
Congratulations Kayleigh, and thank you for your true act of bravery!
